name: redis
description: What is Redis? Redis is an open-source, in-memory data structure store that can be used as a cache, database, and message broker. It stands for Remote Dictionary Server and is known for its speed, simplicity, and versatility. Redis stores data in key-value pairs and supports various data types, including strings, lists, sets, hashes, and more. It is widely used for caching frequently accessed data, real-time analytics, leaderboard functionality, and session management.
